case_title: SHABBIR AHMED SHAIKH vs GOVERNMENT OF BALUCHISTAN And OTHER

facts.auction_participation: Petitioner deposited Rs.80,000 as earnest money/security deposit.
facts.highest_bid: Petitioner made the highest bid but it was not accepted by Respondent No.1.
facts.refund_attempts: Petitioner made continuous attempts for refund but was denied by Respondent No.3.
facts.security_transfer: Respondent No.3 transferred the security deposit to Respondent No.2 citing arrears of Rs.83,445.

legal_points_raised_by_petitioner.separate_causes_of_action: Contract of 1984-85 and earnest money deposit are separate causes of action.
legal_points_raised_by_petitioner.legal_recovery: Respondent No.2 could have pursued legal proceedings for recovery of dues.
legal_points_raised_by_petitioner.rule_violation: Rule 225(6) of West Pakistan Municipal Committees Octroi Rules, 1964 mandates refund of earnest money if bid is not accepted.

arguments_by_advocate_general.delay_and_laches: Petition filed after significant delay (impugned order passed on 24-7-1985, petition filed on 25-10-1986).
arguments_by_advocate_general.alternate_remedy: Petitioner had alternate remedy via appeal under Chapter XXVIII of Octroi Rules.
arguments_by_advocate_general.contractual_nature: Matter pertains to contractual obligations, suitable for ordinary civil court.
arguments_by_advocate_general.default_status: Petitioner is a defaulter with Rs.84,445 outstanding.

court_findings.jurisdiction: Respondent No.3 acted without lawful authority in withholding or transferring the security deposit.
court_findings.adequate_remedy: Appeal was not an adequate remedy given Respondent No.1's rejection of the bid.
court_findings.rule_violation: Rule 225(6) explicitly requires refund of earnest money if bid is not confirmed.
court_findings.delay: Petitioner continuously pursued refund, and delay does not bar relief.

court_decision.refund_order: Respondent No.3 directed to refund Rs.80,000 to the petitioner forthwith.
court_decision.liberty_to_recover_dues: Respondent No.2 may take legal action to recover outstanding dues.
